html.p: What: pastes two result sets together, horizontally

ol.li: Does it in at least as "dumb" of a way as append
But that's OK, there's still no way to be smart about it
CAN ONLY be used after a generating command or a transforming command
Generating commands like makeresults or transforming commands like stats that output a table
If fieldnames collide, you lose data

html.p: Why: Even more unusual to need this than append itself
So What: Few use cases, but it's one of those commands to be aware of because sometimes it's the only command that will do what you need.

The data we are using for this command -
Data 1 - a previous makeresults:
Data 2 - an inputlookup we built earlier. To build this see outputlookup.
While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is:

html.tt: | makeresults format=json data="[{\"name\":\"John\", \"age\":35}, {\"name\":\"Sarah\", \"age\":39}]" | appendcols [ | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv ]
html.p: gets this behavior and output. Notice the two rows of _time only, other rows got overwritten with "nothings"

search.query: | makeresults format=json data="[{\"name\":\"John\", \"age\":35}, {\"name\":\"Sarah\", \"age\":39}]" | appendcols [ | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv ]
